visualAcuity.title: Visual Acuity Test

instructions.title: Instructions:
instructions.step1: Cover your {{otherEye}} eye with your hand
instructions.step2: Look at the letter "E" on the screen
instructions.step3: Tap the arrow button showing which direction the E is pointing
instructions.step4: The E will get smaller as you progress
instructions.note: Keep your device at arm's length (~40cm) for accurate results

visualAcuity.question: Which direction is the E pointing?

20/10.label: Exceptional vision
20/10.description: Better than average - you can see at 20 feet what most people see at 10 feet

20/25.label: Near normal
20/25.description: Slightly below average but usually acceptable

20/32.label: Mild reduction
20/32.description: You may benefit from corrective lenses

20/100.label: Low vision
20/100.description: Please consult an eye care professional

20/200.label: Very low vision
20/200.description: Please consult an eye care professional promptly

instructions.title: Instructions:
instructions.step1: Look at the colored circle pattern
instructions.step2: Type the number you see hidden in the dots
instructions.step3: If you can't see a number, type "0" or leave blank
instructions.step4: Complete all plates for your result
instructions.note: Ensure your screen brightness is at maximum

contrastSensitivity.title: Contrast Sensitivity Test
contrastSensitivity.subtitle: Testing your {{eye}} eye

instructions.title: Instructions:
instructions.step1: Cover your {{otherEye}} eye with your hand
instructions.step2: Look at the letter displayed on screen
instructions.step3: Type the letter you see using the keyboard
instructions.step4: Letters will fade as you progress to test sensitivity
instructions.note: Ensure your screen brightness is consistent

contrastSensitivity.question: What letter do you see?
contrastSensitivity.levelUp: Level up! The letter is now fainter.

significant.label: Significantly reduced
significant.description: Please consult an eye care professional

amslerGrid.title: Amsler Grid Test
amslerGrid.subtitle: Testing your {{eye}} eye

instructions.title: Instructions:
instructions.step1: Cover your {{otherEye}} eye with your hand
instructions.step2: Focus on the red dot in the center of the grid
instructions.step3: Keep focusing on the dot while answering questions
instructions.step4: Answer honestly about what you see
instructions.note: Keep your device at reading distance (~30cm)

amslerGrid.focusPrompt: Focus on the red dot in the center

questions.missingAreas: Are there any missing or blurry areas?
questions.wavyLines: Do any lines appear wavy or distorted?
questions.darkSpots: Do you see any dark spots or holes?

results.title: Test Complete!
results.normalDescription: Your central vision appears healthy for this eye.
results.concernsDescription: Please consider consulting an eye care professional for a comprehensive exam.

astigmatism.title: Astigmatism Screening
astigmatism.subtitle: Testing your {{eye}} eye

instructions.title: Instructions:
instructions.step1: Cover your {{otherEye}} eye with your hand
instructions.step2: Focus on the red dot in the center of the dial
instructions.step3: Look at all the lines radiating outward
instructions.step4: Tap any lines that appear darker or bolder than others
instructions.note: If all lines look equally dark, select 'All lines equal'

astigmatism.question: Do any lines appear darker than others?
astigmatism.selectDarker: Tap the darker lines, or select all equal below

results.title: Test Complete!
results.possibleAstigmatismDesc: Some lines appeared darker, suggesting uneven corneal curvature.

explanation.normal: Your responses indicate that all lines on the clock dial appeared equally clear, which suggests your cornea has a regular curvature. This is a good sign for astigmatism screening.
explanation.detected: You reported that some lines appeared darker or bolder than others. This can indicate astigmatism, where the cornea has an irregular curvature. The axis indicates the approximate direction of the irregularity.

recommendation.normal: ✓ Continue with regular annual eye exams
recommendation.detected: ⚠️ Recommendation: Schedule an appointment with an eye care professional for a comprehensive evaluation

peripheralVision.title: Peripheral Vision Test
peripheralVision.subtitle: Testing your {{eye}} eye

instructions.title: Instructions:
instructions.step1: Cover your {{otherEye}} eye with your hand
instructions.step2: Focus on the red dot in the center of the screen
instructions.step3: White dots will appear in your peripheral vision
instructions.step4: Tap anywhere on the screen when you see a dot
instructions.note: Keep looking at the center dot - use your side vision to detect the dots

peripheralVision.focusPrompt: Keep your focus on the red dot
peripheralVision.tapInstruction: Tap when you see a white dot appear

explanation.normal: Your peripheral vision test results are within normal range. You were able to detect most dots appearing in your side vision with good reaction times.
explanation.concerns: Your results suggest some difficulty detecting objects in your peripheral vision. This could indicate early signs of conditions like glaucoma. However, many factors can affect this test, including fatigue or distraction.

recommendation.normal: ✓ Continue with regular annual eye exams
recommendation.concerns: ⚠️ Recommendation: Schedule an appointment with an eye care professional for a comprehensive visual field test

eyePhoto.title: Eye Photo Analysis
eyePhoto.subtitle: Analyze your eye photo with AI

instructions.title: For best results:
instructions.step1: Use good lighting - face a window or light source
instructions.step4: Keep steady and tap to capture

eyePhoto.apiKeyPrompt: Enter your OpenAI API key to analyze
eyePhoto.disclaimer: AI analysis is for educational purposes only and cannot diagnose conditions.

welcome.title: Welcome to VisionCheck AI
welcome.description: A quick way to screen your eye health from your phone.

visualAcuity.title: Visual Acuity Test
visualAcuity.description: Test how clearly you can see at different sizes using the Tumbling E chart.

colorVision.title: Color Vision Test
colorVision.description: Screen for color blindness using Ishihara-style plates.

contrastSensitivity.title: Contrast Sensitivity
contrastSensitivity.description: Test your ability to distinguish faint letters from their background.

amslerGrid.title: Amsler Grid Test
amslerGrid.description: Screen for macular degeneration by checking for visual distortions.

disclaimer.title: Important Note
disclaimer.description: This app is for screening only—not a medical diagnosis. Always consult an eye care professional.
